timeline.bodyText:
We need this config to be able to control the snapshot trigger from Ratis side for testing purposes. For some tests (TestOzoneManagerHA, OM HA robot tests) we need to set a lower value for auto trigger threshold so that logs can be purged which in turn can instantiate install snapshots.
We can keep it as an internal config and not expose it to users.

timeline.bodyText:
This class seems redundant now. The getTermIndex() is only used in tests.
There are two options:

We can either update OMRatisSnapshotInfo on every DB flush when transactionInfo is updated to keep snapshotInfo in memory. But this update and DB update operation would need to be atomic and there is not mych used for it too.
The second option is to get rid of OMRatisSnapshotInfo and always read from DB for snapshotIndex.
timeline.author: hanishakoneru

replies.bodyText: This is needed during returning getLatestSnapshot in OMStateMachine.
replies.author: bharatviswa504

timeline.bodyText: getLatestSnapshot is used internally in Ratis during state reload. During reload or restart, getLastAppliedTermIndex would be 0,-1. The TransactionInfo stored in DB should be returned here instead.
timeline.author: hanishakoneru

replies.bodyText: This is already taken care during start and reload. We are setting the snapshotInfo from DB values. So, I think this should be fine here.
replies.author: bharatviswa504

timeline.bodyText: We should return the flushed TransactionInfo#logIndex here too. TransactionIndex returned via getLastAppliedIndex() might not have been flushed to DB yet. And logs could be purged upto this index. And if OM crashes before the transactions are flushed to disk by OMDoubleBuffer, there could be data loss.
timeline.author: hanishakoneru

replies.bodyText: Good catch. Done

timeline.bodyText:
We should return the flushed TransactionInfo#logIndex here too. TransactionIndex returned via getLastAppliedIndex() might not have been flushed to DB yet. And logs could be purged upto this index. And if OM crashes before the transactions are flushed to disk by OMDoubleBuffer, there could be data loss.

DBStore.flush() would not flush all the transactions in OMDoubleBuffer to disk, right?
timeline.author: hanishakoneru

replies.bodyText: Yes. It would not.
replies.author: bharatviswa504

replies.bodyText: So this needs to be fixed then. Or could lead to data loss.
replies.author: hanishakoneru

replies.bodyText: Why it will lead to data loss. We are returning already flushed index, and ratis only does log purge which have been flushed to DB.
replies.author: bharatviswa504

replies.bodyText: So, that is the reason get lastAppliedIndex first, then flush. If we change the order, it will lead to data loss.
replies.author: bharatviswa504
